stream_context.summary: Kaze live–debugs the Goomba King boss arena: rewrites spiky-Goomba AI, tunes the boulder push mechanic, re-imports models/animations, adds mip-maps, fixes N64 lighting bugs, experiments with a bloom shader, and micro-optimises collision. Frequent on-stream coordination with Biobak about art assets and future video titles.

development_findings.summary: The Goomba King boss fight is being overhauled: spiky Goombas now push a boulder that the player must steer into the boss; Kaze rewrote movement logic, fixed range errors, and added door/shadow behaviour.
development_findings.quote: Our mission today is fixing the Goombas fight. Biobak wanted to make a few changes to it.

development_findings.summary: A bug where spiky Goombas vanished was traced to a pitch-angle calculation; code was patched to remove the single frame that caused the graph to spike.
development_findings.quote: You see how it just kind of disappears for a bit… There is one moment in the face-angle pitch where this graph just goes crazy.

development_findings.summary: Mip-maps have been implemented and verified on real N64 hardware, improving texture stability without visible artefacts.
development_findings.quote: Look at this. Mipmaps. I did it.

development_findings.summary: Lighting on original hardware was fixed by correcting a macro; overworld lights and crash in that area are now resolved.
development_findings.quote: I also fixed the lights on N64.

development_findings.summary: Kaze prototyped a bloom effect that costs ~7 ms of RDP time; acceptable only for very small sub-areas and shelved for later use.
development_findings.quote: If it's only 7 milliseconds, it is usable in sub-areas that are really close to perfect.

development_findings.summary: Collision and geometry in the boss arena were simplified to stop Goombas getting stuck and to save memory/FPS.
development_findings.quote: This saves like three bytes of RAM size… Actually, also, this is a very, very minor FPS boost.

development_findings.summary: Random vector code was corrected to output –1…1 instead of 0…1; also replaced diameter with radius to optimise distance checks.
development_findings.quote: It generated numbers between 0 and 1, not between minus 1 and 1. That would do it.

development_findings.summary: Workflow uses Fast64 and Blender for N64-ready exports; Kaze notes Fast64 auto-generated an odd animation table that he had to correct.
development_findings.quote: Really cool how you can just use Blender. It's called Fast64.

context_findings.summary: Kaze receives comments questioning more Mario 64 content; clarifies he is building a new game and uses negative feedback as improvement fuel.
context_findings.quote: They think I'm just making videos… I'm making my own game.

context_findings.summary: Upcoming content plan: BLJ explainer video (target Saturday), then "The secret reason I've been rewriting Mario 64" reveal, then Missing Link update video.
context_findings.quote: Hopefully this Saturday, the BLJ video… then a video just gonna be titled like 'so about that N64 game I've been working on'.

context_findings.summary: Marketing philosophy: strong titles/thumbnails are multiplicative with watch-time; wants click-appeal without falling into "YouTube slop" territory.
context_findings.quote: You need the title and thumbnail to get the foot in the door… but I don't want to be branded as slop.

context_findings.summary: Nintendo DMCA worries are circulating; Kaze notes legal counsel is too expensive but is monitoring the situation.
context_findings.quote: There's some stuff going on with Nintendo takedowns and a lot of people are very worried about it… Lawyers are very expensive.

context_findings.summary: Personal view: sustained indie dev requires near-obsessive work ethic; self-discipline sometimes enforced by playful self-punishment.
context_findings.quote: If you want to be successful making video games you need to be mentally unwell… just keep working.

context_findings.summary: Kaze mentions turning 29 soon and planning an April Fool’s Mr Beast-style viral video.
context_findings.quote: I'm gonna be 29 in like two weeks… I want to make a Mr Beast video for the next April first.

biobak.summary: Requested specific tweaks to Goomba boss fight and provided updated Goomba King model, spike Goombas, and boss-door assets.
Suggested higher-impact YouTube titles such as "The secret reason I've been rewriting Mario 64," which Kaze predicts will significantly raise views.
biobak.quote: Biobak's idea was 'the secret reason I've been rewriting Mario 64' which is just insane… that title goes hard.

biobak.summary: Discussed UI overhaul needs but wants it to feel like a natural evolution of Mario 64 rather than a direct 3D World lift.
biobak.quote: It has to be like, here is a UI that is a natural evolution of Mario 64's UI.

zeina.summary: Responsible for Goomba King animations; kick, angry, and sleep animations are still missing, and Kaze plans to send her the updated file and list.
zeina.quote: I'm going to write Zeina the animations we need… And then I will send Zeina the newest file.

key_stories.title: Re-engineering the Goomba King encounter
key_stories.summary: Biobak requested a more dynamic boss. Kaze redesigned the arena so two spiky Goombas push a boulder that players redirect into the Goomba King. He debugged vanishing enemies, adjusted AI ranges, and added doors and shadows.
key_stories.challenge: Original fight felt static and had a bug where Goombas disappeared.
key_stories.process: Re-wrote AI, fixed pitch-angle glitch, corrected random vectors, simplified collision, and linked door/shadow behaviour.
key_stories.outcome: Fight now functions mechanically; only kick/angry animations and doors’ fade-in require art polish.
key_stories.key_quote: Our mission today is fixing the Goombas fight. Biobak wanted to make a few changes to it.

key_stories.title: Mip-map breakthrough on real hardware
key_stories.summary: Textures shimmered on N64. Kaze implemented and tested mip-maps, showing them live to Biobak and chat.
key_stories.challenge: Texture aliasing and performance costs on original hardware.
key_stories.process: Added mip-map generation, flashed test scenes, confirmed no artefacts.
key_stories.outcome: Mip-maps are now part of the engine and will ship in all areas.
key_stories.key_quote: Look at this. Mipmaps. I did it.

key_stories.title: Bloom shader experiment
key_stories.summary: Kaze attempted a modern bloom effect. It looked good but consumed 7 ms of RDP time.
key_stories.process: Integrated third-party code, profiled on hardware, reviewed visual quality.
key_stories.outcome: Effect shelved for limited sub-areas due to cost.
key_stories.key_quote: I tried to implement a bloom effect… it cost him 7 milliseconds of RDP time.

key_stories.title: Finding the perfect YouTube hook
key_stories.summary: Kaze worried his explanatory videos under-perform. Brainstorming with Biobak produced catchier titles predicted to triple views.
key_stories.challenge: Communicating the project’s vision to a broader audience without being seen as clickbait.
key_stories.process: Discussed algorithm behaviour, compared ‘slop’ thumbnails, and A/B-estimated view counts.
key_stories.outcome: Tentative adoption of "The secret reason I've been rewriting Mario 64" and similar hooks for upcoming releases.
key_stories.key_quote: That title goes hard… just from the title change alone 300,000 views.
